intro: Cousinia silyboides subsp. zardkuhensis, commonly known as Zardkuh cousinia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the arid regions of Iran. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy yellow to orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand harsh, dry conditions. It is often found in mountainous areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
